sections.title: Welcome to FRC Programming
sections.content: Welcome to the FRC programming curriculum. This guide takes you from a complete beginner to an advanced programmer, covering the WPILib framework, Command-Based programming, control theory, and professional development practices.

sections.title: Important Disclaimer
sections.subtitle: Official Documentation
items: This curriculum is a learning guide, not a rulebook.
Always refer to official FRC and WPILib documentation for the most up-to-date rules and APIs.
Safety first: Always follow safety procedures when working with physical robots.

sections.title: Curriculum Structure
sections.content:
The curriculum is divided into tiered modules to guide your learning journey:

1. Environment Setup: Installing tools (VS Code, WPILib, Driver Station) and understanding the project structure.
2. Basics: Motor control, reading sensors, and handling joystick inputs.
3. Command-Based Programming: The industry-standard architecture for FRC robots, separating hardware from logic.
4. Control Theory: PID control, feedforward, and motion profiling for smooth, accurate movement.
5. Pose Estimation: Tracking your robot's position on the field using odometry and vision.
6. Advanced Topics: Simulation, unit testing, and path planning.
